channel.title: A Change In The Rules Needed?
channel.description:
Ok, I'm guilty for both of these, but I must protest about myself and others.
[b][u]Leaving Threads[/u][/b]
People seem to be just leaving to see what replies they get on their thread. I know I made a leaving thread and all, and came back within a short period of time, which was unexpected ;). There are lots of them at the moment. An example of this would be a guy called "wall of fir". He made a leaving thread saying he would be gone for 3 weeks, and then came back a week later to make a thread "my 3 weeks are up".
Another example would be, forgot his name xD. He made a thread saying "Leaving RuneScape sections" and it said inside, I'm leaving the runescape section to get more involved in SCAR. I mean how the fuck does that even work?
I'm asking that leaving threads be posted and locked. Just so people can make note and not bother about "bumping them". I also ask that they get permission to make a leaving thread.
For example, a Junior Member would get declined to make one, but a Senior Member with 30+ rep would be allowed to make one. Just a though
[b][u]Advertising[/u][/b]
I, again, an guilty. I posted a advert in the Graphics section with my new forum, but I think advertising needs to be restricted. Maybe the admins granting permission would have to base it on something like:
Forum subject - If it's something like "RS2 ch33ting" then you would say declined, but if it was something new and original, it would be accepted.
Domain - Maybe only accepting paid domains. E.G .com, .net, .org ect. This might be too strict, as not everyone can afford/get hosting.
Advertising Thread Content - If it's something like "looking for 5 admins and 10 G. Mods, first forum member who enter get them" then they wouldn't be allowed to advertise. Lets face it, any forum that runs like that has no chance in a million years to be successful.
I know some of those "rules" or "guidelines" may seem harsh, but Mopar, your being too soft ;)
Well, thanks for reading xx
